docs.lead_paragraph: "Agriculture 18 the most healthy, the most useful, and the most noble employment of man." It must be true, for WASHINGTON said it; but, humph! if he had not said it, what perfect nonsense it would have been ! Probably our people know, and who of them practice upon the absurd aphorism ?

headline.main: PHILADELPHIA.; Health of Philadelphia--The Yellow Fever--Business Matters, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our bill of mortality, during the past week, shows a list of 198 deaths, of which 100 were children. Seven fatal cases of yellow fever are reported, and six malignant and five scarlet. The malignant cases may be set down as yellow fever, beyond all doubt. There were nineteen deaths by consumption, and sixteen by dysentery. Among the whole, sixteen died in the Almshouse, and only six were colored persons.

docs.lead_paragraph: STATISTICS OF NEW-YORK. Births, Marriages, and Deaths in the City-August, 1853. The City Inspector's monthly Statement of the number of Births, Marriages, and Deaths in this City, for the month of August, has just been completed.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cholera has fallen upon England in earnest. It does not appear suddenly, nor in parts which had been well fortified by cleanliness or even by common attention to sanitary regulations. It bursts forth as it did in 1832, at the North, and works southward.

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; ARRIVAL OF THE BLACK WARRIOR. The Lady Suffolk--The Imprissned Americans--General News. The steamer Black Warrior, J. D. BULLOCK, U.

docs.lead_paragraph: S. N. Commander, arrived on Sunday morning from Mobile and Havana. She left the first named port on the 24th inst., and the latter on the 27th. The steamship Philadelphia, for New-York, sailed from Havana on the 26th of September, with one wheel, with the Havan a mails of the 15th.

headline.main: LAW COURTS.; THE CENTRAL PARK. Supreme Court--Special Term. The Mechanics' Lien Law--Opinion of Judge Thompson. Decisions in Admiralty on Appeal.

docs.lead_paragraph: BEFORE HON. JUDGE MITCHELL. Yesterday being appointed for the hearing of this most important matter, the various parties, represented by their several counsel, appared before the Court. Mr. R. DILLON, the Corporation Counsel, presented a petition from the Common Council for the appointment of Commissioners under the act, with the usual affidavits annexed to such petition.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITy.; GREAT MOVEMENT OF INVENTORS. Meetings of Inventors. Formation of a National Inventors' Union, THE CRYSTAL PALACE EXHIBITORS. Testimonial to the Officers of the Steamship Washington. THE COURTS.-The Civil and the Criminal Courts City Mortality. CADETS FROM WHITE PLAINS. RAILROAD ACCIDENT. ST. ANN'S CHURCH FOR DEAF-MUTES. YOUNG SOLDIERS. EXTENSION OF CANAL STREET. A NEW WAY TO DO GOOD. REGATTA. THE POLICE FORCE INADEQUATE. PHRENOLOGICAL LECTURE WASHINGTON NATIONAL MONUMENT. NORTHWESTERN DISPENSARY.

docs.lead_paragraph: An important movement is going on among the Inventors who have articles on exhibition at the Crustal Palace. They seek to protect themselves by an organization for mutual benefit, and have commenced the formation of a "National Inventors' Union," the object of which are fully set forth in the resolutions given below. The last meeing of the body was held on Saturday.
